pullRequest.body:
Define exponential map for algebras
---
This PR defines the exponential map for algebras. The given definition is in analogy with the usual exponential series and provides meaningful values for nilpotent elements of algebras.

This work is part of the framework:
https://github.com/orgs/leanprover-community/projects/17
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [889caa9fa4](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22316/commits/889caa9fa4e13ba73181e89208abf525b61f8457)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Algebra.Exp` (new file)|825|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ exp`
`+ exp_add_of_commute`
`+ exp_eq_truncated`
`+ exp_of_nilpotent_is_unit`
`+ exp_zero_eq_one`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Thanks very much for this; I probably won't have time to review till the weekend but it's looking great!

:v: jano-wol can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Thanks, this is very nice work.

1. Please apply the style suggestions I have provided for `exp_add_of_commute`.
2. Please move this file to be `RingTheory/Nilpotent/Exp.lean` instead of `Algebra/Algebra/Exp.lean`.
3. Please place these results in the `IsNilpotent` namespace rather than the `Algebra` namespace.
4. [optional] If you wish you can also rewrite the proof sufficiently to use the antidiagonal approach.

bors d+
Thanks for this. I have one remark about the generality so I'll do a detailed review after you've had a chance to reply but overall this looks excellent.

Thanks, this is very nice work.

1. Please apply the style suggestions I have provided for `exp_add_of_commute`.
2. Please move this file to be `RingTheory/Nilpotent/Exp.lean` instead of `Algebra/Algebra/Exp.lean`.
3. Please place these results in the `IsNilpotent` namespace rather than the `Algebra` namespace.
4. [optional] If you wish you can also rewrite the proof sufficiently to use the antidiagonal approach.

bors d+

I think we should drop `R` and instead just assume we have `` coefficients. To be precise I propose:
```lean
variable {A : Type*} [Ring A] [Algebra  A]
```
Note that this painlessly covers the case of a field of characteristic zero since:
```lean
example (A : Type*) [DivisionRing A] [CharZero A] : Algebra  A := inferInstance
```
(to test this you need `import Mathlib.Algebra.Algebra.Rat`).

In fact this gives an example of why I think having `R` will be awkward. If `K` is a field of characteristic zero then with the current definition we have two names for the same map: `exp K K` and `exp  K`.

I also note that you have gone to some trouble to support the case where `A` might not have subtraction but I propose we leave this out unless you have an application in mind. If we did want to support it, we could do:
```lean
variable (A : Type*) [Semiring A] [Algebra 0 A]
```
but I think we'll probably run into issues since the library is bound to have some gaps associated with passing between `0` and ``.

Thanks for the feedback, I applied the suggested change to
`variable {A : Type*} [Ring A] [Algebra  A]`

This made the notation somewhat simpler throughout the file  thanks for that!
I also dropped the semiring generality, since I didnt have any particular use case for it.

Here are a bunch of style suggestions (no change mathematically):
```suggestion
  obtain n, hn := h
  obtain n, hn := h
  let N := n  n
  have h : a ^ (N + 1) = 0 := pow_eq_zero_of_le (by omega) hn
  have h : b ^ (N + 1) = 0 := pow_eq_zero_of_le (by omega) hn
  rw [ exp_eq_truncated (k := 2 * N + 1)
    (Commute.add_pow_eq_zero_of_add_le_succ_of_pow_eq_zero h h h (by omega)),
     exp_eq_truncated h,  exp_eq_truncated h]
  set R2N := range (2 * N + 1) with hR2N
  set RN := range (N + 1) with hRN
  have s := by
    calc  i  R2N, (i ! : )  (a + b) ^ i
        =  i  R2N, (i ! : )   j  range (i + 1), a ^ j * b ^ (i - j) * i.choose j := ?_
      _ =  i  R2N, ( j  range (i + 1),
            ((j ! : ) * ((i - j) ! : ))  (a ^ j * b ^ (i - j))) := ?_
      _ =  ij  R2N  R2N with ij.1 + ij.2  2 * N,
            ((ij.1 ! : ) * (ij.2 ! : ))  (a ^ ij.1 * b ^ ij.2) := ?_
     refine sum_congr rfl fun i _  ?_
      rw [Commute.add_pow h i]
     simp_rw [smul_sum]
      refine sum_congr rfl fun i hi  sum_congr rfl fun j hj  ?_
      simp only [mem_range] at hi hj
      replace hj := Nat.le_of_lt_succ hj
      suffices (i ! : ) * (i.choose j) = ((j ! : ) * ((i - j)! : )) by
        rw [ Nat.cast_commute (i.choose j),  this,  Algebra.mul_smul_comm,  nsmul_eq_mul,
          mul_smul,  smul_assoc, smul_comm, smul_assoc]
        norm_cast
      rw [Nat.choose_eq_factorial_div_factorial hj,
        Nat.cast_div (Nat.factorial_mul_factorial_dvd_factorial hj) (by field_simp)]
      field_simp
     rw [hR2N, sum_sigma']
      apply sum_bij (fun i, j _  (j, i - j))
       simp only [mem_sigma, mem_range, mem_filter, mem_product, and_imp]
        omega
       simp only [mem_sigma, mem_range, Prod.mk.injEq, and_imp]
        rintro x, y - h x, y - h h h
        simp_all
        omega
       simp only [mem_filter, mem_product, mem_range, mem_sigma, exists_prop, Sigma.exists,
          and_imp, Prod.forall, Prod.mk.injEq]
        exact fun x y _ _ _  x + y, x, by omega
       simp only [mem_sigma, mem_range, implies_true]
  have z :  ij  R2N  R2N with  ij.1 + ij.2  2 * N,
      ((ij.1 ! : ) * (ij.2 ! : ))  (a ^ ij.1 * b ^ ij.2) = 0 :=
    sum_eq_zero fun i hi  by
      rw [mem_filter] at hi
      cases le_or_lt (N + 1) i.1 with
        | inl h => rw [pow_eq_zero_of_le h h, zero_mul, smul_zero]
        | inr _ => rw [pow_eq_zero_of_le (by linarith) h, mul_zero, smul_zero]
  have split := sum_filter_add_sum_filter_not (R2N  R2N)
    (fun ij  ij.1 + ij.2  2 * N)
    (fun ij  ((ij.1 ! : ) * (ij.2 ! : ))  (a ^ ij.1 * b ^ ij.2))
  rw [z, add_zero] at split
  rw [split] at s
  have z :  ij  R2N  R2N with  (ij.1  N  ij.2  N),
      ((ij.1 ! : ) * (ij.2 ! : ))  (a ^ ij.1 * b ^ ij.2) = 0 :=
    sum_eq_zero fun i hi  by
    simp only [not_and, not_le, mem_filter] at hi
    cases le_or_lt (N + 1) i.1 with
      | inl h => rw [pow_eq_zero_of_le h h, zero_mul, smul_zero]
      | inr h => rw [pow_eq_zero_of_le (hi.2 (Nat.le_of_lt_succ h)) h, mul_zero, smul_zero]
  have split := sum_filter_add_sum_filter_not (R2N  R2N)
    (fun ij  ij.1  N  ij.2  N)
    (fun ij  ((ij.1 ! : ) * (ij.2 ! : ))  (a ^ ij.1 * b ^ ij.2))
  rw [z, add_zero] at split
  rw [ split] at s
  have restrict:  ij  R2N  R2N with ij.1  N  ij.2  N,
      ((ij.1 ! : ) * (ij.2 ! : ))  (a ^ ij.1 * b ^ ij.2) =
         ij  RN  RN, ((ij.1 ! : ) * (ij.2 ! : ))  (a ^ ij.1 * b ^ ij.2) := by
    apply sum_congr
     ext x
      simp only [mem_filter, mem_product, mem_range, hR2N, hRN]
      omega
     tauto
  rw [restrict] at s
  have s := by
    calc ( i  RN, (i ! : )  a ^ i) *  i  RN, (i ! : )  b ^ i
        =  i  RN,  j  RN, ((i ! : ) * (j ! : ))  (a ^ i * b ^ j) := ?_
      _ =  ij  RN  RN, ((ij.1 ! : ) * (ij.2 ! : ))  (a ^ ij.1 * b ^ ij.2) := ?_
     rw [sum_mul_sum]
      refine sum_congr rfl fun _ _  sum_congr rfl fun _ _  ?_
      rw [smul_mul_assoc, Algebra.mul_smul_comm, smul_smul]
     rw [sum_sigma']
      apply sum_bijective (fun i, j  (i, j))
       exact fun i, j i', j' h  by cases h; rfl, fun i, j  i, j, rfl
       simp only [mem_sigma, mem_product, implies_true]
       simp only [implies_true]
  rwa [s.symm] at s
```
Some remarks as follows:

- You'll need to add `open scoped Nat` above (to get access to the notation `n !` for `n.factorial`)
- You'll need to add `import Mathlib.Tactic.FieldSimp` to get access to the `field_simp` tactic
- I think this proof would be somewhat easier if you used the "antidiagonal trick". The point is that it avoids having to interact with the badly-behaved natural number subtraction. To see a simple example, compare the statements of [Commute.add_pow](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Nat/Choose/Sum.html#Commute.add_pow) and [Commute.add_pow'](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Nat/Choose/Sum.html#Commute.add_pow')
- One of the bigger style changes I made above is to defer the proof for the `calc` blocks by writing `:= ?_`. I claim this is preferable style when the proof of a step in the `calc` is long

pullRequest.title: feat: define exponential of nilpotent elements of a ``-algebra
